questions.text: In the opening scene we find the doctors at work in the O.R.  On Hawkeye's table is a wounded soldier with tattoos across his entire body.  After seeing the tattooed soldier, Klinger begins to sing a song about a woman with tattoos.  Who is this woman?
questions.explanation:
Lydia.

	If you aren't familiar with the song, it's entitled 'Lydia, the Tattooed Lady' and was written by Harold Arlen and E. Y. Harburg.  It was most famously performed by the Marx Brothers in the 1939 film 'At the Circus'.   Klinger performs the following from the song: 'Oh Lydia, oh Lydia, say have you met Lydia, Oh Lydia the Tatooed Lady.'

questions.text: BJ is handling an especially difficult case in the O.R.  When his patient begins to hemorrhage he asks for a clamp from the nurse assisting at his table, only to have her run out of the room.  Played by Susan Blanchard, her given name is Sandra, but what is her surname?
questions.explanation:
Cooper.

	Rather than immediately retrieving a clamp for BJ, Cooper runs out of the O.R.  She appears squeamish from the combination of blood and the sight of the faces of such very young soldiers.  Margaret becomes very upset about this dereliction of duty and angrily confronts Nurse Cooper immediately after the operating session.

questions.text: Margaret and Charles find themselves uncomfortably alone (at least, for Margaret) at a table in the mess tent.  They have the good fortune of being joined by Father Mulcahy, Hawkeye and BJ before long.  When all have settled down to their meal, the complaining begins.  What is Charles specific complaint about the meal?
questions.correct: They haven't chilled the salad forks
options: The coffee is most likely domestic
questions.explanation:
They haven't chilled the salad forks.

	'You have single-handedly taken all the whimsy out of this war,' says BJ to Charles.  While the rest of the officers discuss problems with the food, Charles is reminiscing about conditions back home with his serviced meals, complete with all the amenities.  The only amenities he will find in Korea are the multi-compartmented dinner trays and the fresh local goat's milk.

questions.text: While the officers continue their gabfest in the mess tent, Radar approaches the bed of the tattooed patient, Corporal Hendrix, in the post-op tent.  Radar informs Hendrix of the bad news; which of his tattoos was defaced by his battle wound and subsequent surgery?
questions.explanation:
Louise.

	Hendrix is very disappointed to find out about his Louise tattoo.  According to Radar, 'Her face is still pretty, and her legs are the greatest...'  Hendrix interjects, 'What about the rest of her?'  Radar responds, 'Uh, there isn't any.'  Hendrix laments, 'Why couldn't it have been Betty?  Louise was fantastic.  Whenever I got the hiccups, she'd do stuff that would knock your eyes out.'

questions.text: Hendrix provides Radar with a number of reasons to get a tattoo.  Which of these is not one of these benefits, according to Corporal Hendrix?
options: The women won't leave you alone
questions.explanation:
You appear sophisticated.

	After hearing these three reasons (in particular, the one regarding women not leaving one alone) Radar is convinced.  'That's enough,' Radar says, as he walks away from Hendrix.  It appears that Radar is going to bolster his manhood with a new tattoo.

questions.text: Major Houlihan has had just about enough of Sandra, the nurse who has been unable to perform her duties on several occasions.  She takes the case to Colonel Potter.  Does Potter accept Margaret's transfer request for this nurse?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The Colonel overrides Margaret's transfer request, much to the Major's chagrin.  Margaret calls Nurse Cooper a 'crier'.  The Colonel retorts that his wife was also a crier, but that 'after a few months she settled down and for 38 years come April, she's been a mighty fine wife'.  Potter gets Margaret to agree grudgingly to allow Cooper a chance to stick around.

questions.text: In the Swamp, Hawkeye and BJ make silly chit-chat about world affairs.  Charles is offended when his two tentmates disparage 'one of the greatest military minds of the century'.  To whom does Charles refer?
questions.explanation:
Douglas MacArthur.

	Actually, their dialogue is quite tame, really, but Charles is in no mood for their vaudevillian humor.  However, his defense of MacArthur falls on deaf ears.  Hawkeye 'concedes' that MacArthur has 'got the whole country wearing sunglasses', while BJ, who calls MacArthur 'Dugout Doug', adds, 'Even my wife smokes a corncob pipe.'  To add insult to injury, BJ and Hawkeye, when requested for once to end an argument intelligently, give Charles a collective raspberry.

questions.text: Knowing that Radar means to get a tattoo, Hawkeye and BJ go into action to try and prevent the little tyke from following through with his plan.  They recruit a marine who happens to be at the 4077th to convince Radar to change his mind.  This marine claims to have contracted what disease after receiving one of his tattoos?
questions.explanation:
Hepatitis.

	Marine Sergeant Rimmerman shows off one of his various tattoos, the marine emblem, complete with the words 'semper fidelis', on his arm. He orders a grape nehi, but not because he enjoys it.  According to Rimmerman, he is not allowed to drink any alcoholic beverages for six months because he contracted hepatitis after getting a 'mother' tattoo.   Radar buys into the Sergeant's story until Klinger gives the whole ploy away.  Radar is indignant, and claims he will get a snake tattoo immediately.

questions.text: An event occurs that gives Margaret a change of heart about the nurse that she means to have transferred off the compound.  What is it that happens that upsets Margaret a great deal?
questions.correct: A dog is killed by a jeep
options: A child is born of a local woman
A friend back in the states has passed away
A young child is injured on a landmine
questions.explanation:
A dog is killed by a jeep.

	In the mess tent, Margaret overhears a conversation about a small dog that she has been feeding.  Apparently, the little mutt was hit by a jeep and killed.  Margaret becomes very upset and begins to cry.  Hawkeye notices and follows her into her tent demanding to know why she has taken to tears.   After her encounter with Hawkeye, Margaret decides to confront Cooper about her recent behavior.  Margaret admits that she has been too hard on Nurse Cooper and means to give her another chance.

questions.text: The end of the episode features a scene with BJ, Hawkeye, Colonel Potter and Radar in Radar's office.  Radar announces that he has gotten a tattoo, though it's actually just an ink drawing.  What is featured in Radar's tattoo?
questions.explanation:
A teddy bear.

	Initially, Radar refuses to show BJ and Hawkeye his 'tattoo'.  They discover that Radar has decided to put his little mark on his tush.  Colonel Potter commands Radar to expose his rump, and the three doctors see Radar's little teddy bear in the buff.  Fortunately for Radar, the teddy bear is not permanent, but rather will wash off in a few days. Thank you for playing this quiz, I hope the information within it has been permanently tattooed in your mind.  If you enjoyed it, please feel free to try some of my other 'M*A*S*H'-related stuff.
